thread.section_title: iPhoneIMEI.Net Reviews | Customer Service Reviews of iPhoneIMEI.Net | iphoneimei.net | 4 of 84
thread.title: Unsatisfied Customer

author: Unsatisfied Customer
title: Unsatisfied Customer
text:
When I bought a new iphone SE off EBay which was supposed to be unlocked, but was in fact locked to SoftBank Japan you can imagine I was not best pleased.
I looked everywhere for an unlocking service and it turned out that the SoftBank network in particular was pretty expensive to unlock if the phone was not older than 6 months... £85-£150 to be exact (only £20 if you can get it done by SoftBank directly though)
I was a little hesitant at first to split my with my hard earned cash as it seemed quite excessive to pay so much and still have to wait the estimated 5-20 business days for the whole thing to work out. With no option to get the money for my phone back and not wanting to wait 4 months to unlock though, I finally took the plunge and chose iphoneimei.net to unlock it. Boy am I happy I did!
The service by iphoneimei.net was truly first class. The minute I submitted my order I got a receipt back sending me a tracking number with a page showing a completion status all the way from 0-100%. I also got emails confirming when the order had been sent to the supplier, when there was supposedly a delay (even though it was within the stated timeframe) and also when my phone was completely unlocked.
The unlocking email also had an array of instructions for troubleshooting in case there were issues with the unlock, but for myself all I had to do was put in the new SIM card and it worked straight away without any further troubleshooting needed.
It took about 12 days (8 working days) total to unlock, so well below the 20 day estimate so I was definitely pleased.
Well done iphoneimei.net and thank you for your help- highly recommended!
